Key Arguments: The legislation is an affront to the people of Australia and infringes on their rights.
The proposed ACMA powers are excessive and unnecessary, undermining existing processes and safeguards.
The bill is described as unlawful, immoral, unethical, and unconstitutional.
There is concern over who decides what constitutes misinformation or disinformation, suggesting it could lead to dictatorial control.
The bill is seen as a government overreach and a violation of natural law and the Australian Constitution.
Notable Quotes: The proposal to monitor and surveil information on any platform...is in itself an affront to the men and women of Australia.
A plethora of unlawful, immoral, unethical and unconstitutional issues are readily evident.
The Bill is not lawful in any way shape or form and is totally repugnant to the Australian Constitution and to Natural Law.
No consent whatsoever is given to the introduction of this Communications Legislation Amendment (Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation) Bill 2023.
